match.title: 3rd ODI
match.statusText: Bangladesh won by 8 wickets (with 180 balls remaining)

image.caption: An overview of the Zohur Ahmed Chowdhury Stadium
image.longCaption: An overview of the Zohur Ahmed Chowdhury Stadium, Bangladesh A v England, March 7, 2010

match.hoursInfo: 13.30 start, First Session 13.30-17.00, Interval 17.00-17.45, Second Session 17.45-21.15

headshotImage.caption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kieran Powell b Nasir Hossain 25 (36b 4x4 0x6 52m) SR: 69.44

dismissalComment.html: what a stunner. Powell's gone to a piece of Muralitharanesque mystery from Hossain. Tossed up, curving in, pitched on leg stump, gripped, spun and beat the outside edge to hit off stump and leave the batsman completely befuddled. All similarities with Murali ended there, as Hossain celebrates with an ugly WWE gesture - the DX chop to be spedcific. The crowd seems to like it, though.

headshotImage.caption: Carlos Brathwaite player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Carlos Brathwaite player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Carlos Brathwaite player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Carlos Brathwaite player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Carlos Brathwaite lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 11 (20b 1x4 0x6 23m) SR: 55

dismissalComment.html: 58 is still some way away and the Windies are nine down. They just can't play spin in these conditions. Shakib again sends in that straighter one that just skids along after landing on off stump. Brathwaite offered bat and pad in hope, but the ball missed the willow and headed for the foam. Plumb as they come, despite the big forward stride.

whoa, another wicket. Sammy gives his critics more grist to work with. It was Shakib's usual fare, angled in from slightly wide of the crease and straightening from middle. Sammy played an appalling shot, plonking the front foot forward and looking to play well away from the pad with an angled face when he should have brandished straight bat. He misses, Shakib hits him flush in front, and umpire Reiffel does the rest.

easy as they come. Shakib skids one along, straight in after landing short of a length on off stump. Ramdin's bat-pad gap was so huge as he played for the spin, you could have built a Dubai-standard mall in that space. The ball had the easy job of finding its way through and hitting the stumps.

headshotImage.caption: Carlos Brathwaite player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Carlos Brathwaite player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: 58 is still some way away and the Windies are nine down. They just can't play spin in these conditions. Shakib again sends in that straighter one that just skids along after landing on off stump. Brathwaite offered bat and pad in hope, but the ball missed the willow and headed for the foam. Plumb as they come, despite the big forward stride.

headshotImage.caption: Anthony Martin player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Anthony Martin player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: West Indies have been shot out for their second lowest total. Shakib flights this on leg and gets it to turn, past Martin's optimistic heave across the line, and onto leg stump. They were 33 for 1 at one stage, and have collapsed in bizarre fashion here, against an inspired bunch of Bangladeshis. And what's more, Shakib has 150 wickets. Well bowled, champ!

headshotImage.caption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: what a stunner. Powell's gone to a piece of Muralitharanesque mystery from Hossain. Tossed up, curving in, pitched on leg stump, gripped, spun and beat the outside edge to hit off stump and leave the batsman completely befuddled. All similarities with Murali ended there, as Hossain celebrates with an ugly WWE gesture - the DX chop to be spedcific. The crowd seems to like it, though.

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Two balls back Nasir had no ODI wickets. Now he is on a hat-trick. Tossed up outside off and turning in, draws Pollard forward and he helpfully pats it back to the bowler at a perfect catching height. Windies in big trouble now.

headshotImage.caption: Danza Hyatt player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Danza Hyatt player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Danza Hyatt player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Danza Hyatt player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Imrul Kayes b Nazmul Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Danza Hyatt c Imrul Kayes b Nazmul Hossain 3 (17b 0x4 0x6 25m) SR: 17.64

dismissalComment.html: and that's the end of Hyatt. A touch of frustration in the shot. Length ball, there for the drive outside off, but Hyatt seemed keen to smash it in the air instead of drive along the ground. He just plonked the front foot forward and heaved a touch early into the off side, but the ball took the outside edge to loop into the lone slip's hand.

headshotImage.caption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Sohrawordi Shuvo b Shafiul Islam
dismissalText.commentary: Marlon Samuels c Sohrawordi Shuvo b Shafiul Islam 5 (15b 0x4 0x6 21m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: if you didn't see that coming, you're following the wrong sport. Samuels is on his way. Length ball outside off, Samuels again refuses to reach forward and just looks to carve it over the off side from the crease. No pace to work with, at all. He ends up spooning it to sweeper cover where Shuvo takes an easy catch.

dismissalComment.html: what a stunner. Powell's gone to a piece of Muralitharanesque mystery from Hossain. Tossed up, curving in, pitched on leg stump, gripped, spun and beat the outside edge to hit off stump and leave the batsman completely befuddled. headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kieron Pollard c & b Nasir Hossain 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Two balls back Nasir had no ODI wickets. Now he is on a hat-trick. Tossed up outside off and turning in, draws Pollard forward and he helpfully pats it back to the bowler at a perfect catching height. Windies in big trouble now.

headshotImage.caption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Darren Bravo c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Shafiul Islam 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: If there's rain coming, West Indies are doing their bit to ensure it doesn't wash out the game. Bravo perishes now, to a lazy square drive away from the body as Shafiul plugs away on a length just outside off. The ball did nothing off the pitch, it didn't bounce much either and was dying alarmingly on Rahim who takes a very smart catch, low down.

dismissalText.commentary: Daren Sammy lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 2 (5b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: whoa, another wicket. Sammy gives his critics more grist to work with. It was Shakib's usual fare, angled in from slightly wide of the crease and straightening from middle. Sammy played an appalling shot, plonking the front foot forward and looking to play well away from the pad with an angled face when he should have brandished straight bat. He misses, Shakib hits him flush in front, and umpire Reiffel does the rest.

dismissalText.commentary: Denesh Ramdin b Shakib Al Hasan 4 (8b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: easy as they come. Shakib skids one along, straight in after landing short of a length on off stump. Ramdin's bat-pad gap was so huge as he played for the spin, you could have built a Dubai-standard mall in that space. The ball had the easy job of finding its way through and hitting the stumps.

dismissalText.commentary: Andre Russell c & b Sohrawordi Shuvo 2 (5b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: West Indies are in a daze, they are batting in Zombie-fashion here. Another return catch. Shuvo flights this on middle and leg, a little quicker than the previous ball, and Russell pops it right back at him after reaching out. They haven't made any adjustments for the slow pitch. Unacceptable.

image.caption: Kemar Roach player portrait
image.longCaption: Kemar Roach player portrait, West Indies media day

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes c Pollard b Roach 11 (15b 0x4 1x6 17m) SR: 73.33

dismissalComment.html: Kayes is gone, and there's no noise in the ground. Short and fast from Roach again, who has worked Kayes over with his clever lengths and pace. Concerned about his rib cage, Kayes was on the back foot, committed to fending it to the leg side, but the ball took the leading edge to pop into the covers.

headshotImage.caption: Shahriar Nafees player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shahriar Nafees player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Bangladesh have lost their second wicket earlier than the Windies lost theirs. This was a mirror image of the Ramdin wicket. Samuels slid this through without any pretence of trying to spin it, but Nafees was loose in attempted to steer it well away from the pads. The ball gladly found its way through the gap and disturbed the woodwork before Nafees could yank the bat back.

image.longCaption: Kemar Roach player portrait, West Indies media day

dismissalText.commentary: Shahriar Nafees b Samuels 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Bangladesh have lost their second wicket earlier than the Windies lost theirs. This was a mirror image of the Ramdin wicket. Samuels slid this through without any pretence of trying to spin it, but Nafees was loose in attempted to steer it well away from the pads. headshotImage.caption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

commentTextItems.html: Bangladesh beat the rain, and in the process humble the Windies. Tamim works a full toss off the pads through midwicket for a single that gives Bangladesh one of their most famous wins, regardless of this being a dead rubber. I wonder if there will be any stone-throwing at buses tonight.

commentPostTextItems.html: A suitably sombre Sammy takes away the ODI series trophy. The Test series begins in three days, and he will be concerned about his side's chances in the first Test at the same venue. Do join us for the action on Oct 21, but in the meantime there are four other bilateral series in progress, so you'd do well to keep us bookmarked on your browser. On behalf of the rest of the ESPNcricinfo gang, this is Nitin Sundar signing off. Cheers!

Darren Sammy: "We took our foot off the gas (he pronounces it 'gaas') today. Congratulations to us for winning this series, it is a good feeling, but today shows that you can never take your opponents lightly. It will be a keenly contested Test series. We have seen what Bangladesh can do at home, and we hope to come back and start that series on a high."
Marlon Samuels is Man of the Series despite failing today.

Shakib Al Hasan is the Man of the Match for his four-for. "I always enjoy bowling here," he says. "All our spinners did well, after the new balls got us the breakthrough. We just needed to bat well and stick to our plans after that."

Mushfiqur Rahim: "There was nothing to lose today, and the boys came out and showed character. This is a big lift before the Test series. We wanted to bowl after winning the toss, the pacemen bowled well and were backed up by the spinners. Hopefully we will keep winning in Chittagong."
"Probably the greatest win by Bangladesh and there could not have been a more perfect time than this." Hmm, I'd say the previous game would have been a better time, Sadique.
"Does this prove wives are always wrong?" Well played, Ravi!

headshotImage.caption: Anthony Martin player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Anthony Martin player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Rahim drives with the turn down to long-on for one.
short ball, Rahim cuts it away cautiously.

commentPostTextItems.html: And now there's a drizzle coming down. We need two more balls for a game.

commentTextItems.html: full ball on off stump, defended into the off side.
fired in short, Rahim misses the cut as he backs away.
tossed up on off stump, defended down the track.
turning down the leg side, Tamim helps it along for a couple to fine-leg.

headshotImage.caption: Anthony Martin player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Anthony Martin player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: over-pitched outside off, and finally a touch of the Tamim we all know. He gauges the flight, gets the bat down in time and powers it away through the covers.
strays down the leg side, Tamim nudges down to fine leg for a single.
worked off the pad towards square leg. If Tamim has a plan, I am not getting it.
Tamim skips out and gets pad in the way as he looks to defend.
Rahim covers the line as Samuels straightens one from off stump. Defended down the track.

headshotImage.caption: Anthony Martin player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Anthony Martin player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: fuller this time, Tamim drives down to long-off for a single.
short ball, he goes back to cut but doesn't impart any power.
flighted outside off, Tamim gets forward to defend into the covers.
full toss on leg stump, worked off the pads to midwicket.
tossed up to Tamim who defends down the pitch.
breaking away from the off and middle line, Rahim plays it away defensively.

headshotImage.caption: Anthony Martin player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Anthony Martin player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: fired in on the stumps, nudged off the pads to the leg side.

Length ball outside off, Samuels again refuses to reach forward and just looks to carve it over the off side from the crease. No pace to work with, at all. He ends up spooning it to sweeper cover where Shuvo takes an easy catch.

If there's rain coming, West Indies are doing their bit to ensure it doesn't wash out the game. Bravo perishes now, to a lazy square drive away from the body as Shafiul plugs away on a length just outside off. The ball did nothing off the pitch, it didn't bounce much either and was dying alarmingly on Rahim who takes a very smart catch, low down.

headshotImage.caption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Danza Hyatt player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Danza Hyatt player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and that's the end of Hyatt. A touch of frustration in the shot. Length ball, there for the drive outside off, but Hyatt seemed keen to smash it in the air instead of drive along the ground. He just plonked the front foot forward and heaved a touch early into the off side, but the ball took the outside edge to loop into the lone slip's hand.

headshotImage.caption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: what a stunner. Powell's gone to a piece of Muralitharanesque mystery from Hossain. Tossed up, curving in, pitched on leg stump, gripped, spun and beat the outside edge to hit off stump and leave the batsman completely befuddled. All similarities with Murali ended there, as Hossain celebrates with an ugly WWE gesture - the DX chop to be spedcific. The crowd seems to like it, though.

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Two balls back Nasir had no ODI wickets. Now he is on a hat-trick. Tossed up outside off and turning in, draws Pollard forward and he helpfully pats it back to the bowler at a perfect catching height. Windies in big trouble now.

whoa, another wicket. Sammy gives his critics more grist to work with. It was Shakib's usual fare, angled in from slightly wide of the crease and straightening from middle. Sammy played an appalling shot, plonking the front foot forward and looking to play well away from the pad with an angled face when he should have brandished straight bat. He misses, Shakib hits him flush in front, and umpire Reiffel does the rest.

easy as they come. Shakib skids one along, straight in after landing short of a length on off stump. Ramdin's bat-pad gap was so huge as he played for the spin, you could have built a Dubai-standard mall in that space. The ball had the easy job of finding its way through and hitting the stumps.

headshotImage.caption: Carlos Brathwaite player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Carlos Brathwaite player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: 58 is still some way away and the Windies are nine down. They just can't play spin in these conditions. Shakib again sends in that straighter one that just skids along after landing on off stump. Brathwaite offered bat and pad in hope, but the ball missed the willow and headed for the foam. Plumb as they come, despite the big forward stride.

headshotImage.caption: Anthony Martin player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Anthony Martin player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: West Indies have been shot out for their second lowest total. Shakib flights this on leg and gets it to turn, past Martin's optimistic heave across the line, and onto leg stump. They were 33 for 1 at one stage, and have collapsed in bizarre fashion here, against an inspired bunch of Bangladeshis. And what's more, Shakib has 150 wickets. Well bowled, champ!

West Indies are in a daze, they are batting in Zombie-fashion here. Another return catch. Shuvo flights this on middle and leg, a little quicker than the previous ball, and Russell pops it right back at him after reaching out. They haven't made any adjustments for the slow pitch. Unacceptable.

headshotImage.longCaption: Danza Hyatt player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Kemar Roach player portrait
image.longCaption: Kemar Roach player portrait, West Indies media day

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes c Pollard b Roach 11 (15b 0x4 1x6 17m) SR: 73.33

dismissalComment.html: Kayes is gone, and there's no noise in the ground. Short and fast from Roach again, who has worked Kayes over with his clever lengths and pace. Concerned about his rib cage, Kayes was on the back foot, committed to fending it to the leg side, but the ball took the leading edge to pop into the covers.

headshotImage.caption: Shahriar Nafees player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shahriar Nafees player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shahriar Nafees player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shahriar Nafees player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shahriar Nafees b Samuels 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Bangladesh have lost their second wicket earlier than the Windies lost theirs. This was a mirror image of the Ramdin wicket. Samuels slid this through without any pretence of trying to spin it, but Nafees was loose in attempted to steer it well away from the pads. The ball gladly found its way through the gap and disturbed the woodwork before Nafees could yank the bat back.

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim not out 10 (39b 1x4 0x6 37m) SR: 25.64

notes: Drinks: West Indies - 38/6 in 13.1 overs (D Ramdin 2)
West Indies: 50 runs in 17.2 overs (104 balls), Extras 4
Innings Break: West Indies - 61/10 in 22.0 overs (KAJ Roach 0)
Bangladesh: 50 runs in 16.1 overs (97 balls), Extras 5

stories.title: 'The conditions were in our favour' - Mushfiqur
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v West Indies, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh v West Indies, 3rd ODI: 'The conditions were in our favour,' says Mushfiqur Rahim
stories.summary: A combination of factors helped Bangladesh inflict a huge defeat on West Indies, Mushfiqur Rahim has said

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan and Mushfiqur Rahim celebrate Andre Russell's dismissal
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan and Mushfiqur Rahim celebrate Andre Russell's dismissal, Bangladesh v West Indies, only Twenty20, Mirpur, October 11, 2011

stories.title: Bangladesh win after routing West Indies for 61
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v West Indies, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh v West Indies, 3rd ODI, Chittagong: Bangladesh win after routing West Indies for 61
stories.summary: The threat of rain loomed over gloomy Chittagong but the weather stayed clear enough for Bangladesh to demolish West Indies for their second-lowest total in one-day internationals

image.caption: Suhrawadi Shuvo celebrates a wicket with his team-mates
image.longCaption: Suhrawadi Shuvo celebrates a wicket with his team-mates, Bangladesh v West Indies, 3rd ODI, Chittagong, October 18, 2011

stories.title: Sammy intent on completing series sweep

stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh v West Indies, 3rd ODI: Darren Sammy intent on completing series sweep
